title: India - Geography
description: India is located in South Asia and is the seventh-largest country by area. It shares borders with Pakistan, China, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar.

title: India - Population
description: As of June 2023, India is the most populous country in the world, surpassing China. It has a population of over 1.4 billion people.

title: India - Independence
description: India gained independence from British rule on August 15, 1947, and is celebrated annually as Independence Day.

title: India - Democracy
description: India is the world's most populous democracy. It has a federal parliamentary democratic system.

title: India - Economy
description: India has a mixed economy, with agriculture, manufacturing, and services sectors. It is one of the world's fastest-growing major economies.

title: India - Culture
description: India is known for its rich and diverse culture, including languages, religions, festivals, dance, music, architecture, and cuisine.

title: India - Languages
description: India has 22 officially recognized languages, with Hindi and English being the official languages at the national level.

title: India - Religions
description: India is the birthplace of major religions such as Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism. It is also home to significant populations of Muslims, Christians, and other religious communities.

title: India - Festivals
description: India celebrates numerous festivals, including Diwali, Holi, Eid, Christmas, and many regional festivals, reflecting its cultural diversity.

title: India - Heritage Sites
description: India has several UNESCO World Heritage Sites, including the Taj Mahal, Qutub Minar, Red Fort, and the historic city of Jaipur.

title: India - Technology
description: India is a global leader in information technology and software services, with a robust IT industry centered in cities like Bangalore, Hyderabad, and Pune.

title: India - Education
description: India has a vast and diverse educational system, with renowned institutions like the Indian Institutes of Technology (IITs), Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs), and many prestigious universities.

title: India - Wildlife
description: India is home to a wide variety of wildlife, including Bengal tigers, Asian elephants, Indian rhinoceroses, and many species of birds and reptiles. It has numerous national parks and wildlife sanctuaries.

title: India - Sports
description: Cricket is the most popular sport in India, with a huge following and significant achievements in international competitions. Other popular sports include field hockey, badminton, and football.

title: India - Cuisine
description: Indian cuisine is known for its rich flavors and diverse regional dishes, including staples like curry, biryani, dosa, and sweets like gulab jamun and jalebi.
